title: A Good Set | CodeChef
statement: A set of integers is called  good  if there does not exist three distinct elements a, b, c in it such that a + b = c. Your task is simple. Just output any  good  set of  n  integers. All the elements in this set should be distinct and should lie between 1 and 500, both inclusive. For each test case, output a single line containing  n  integers denoting the elements of the  good  set, in any order. There can be more than one possible good set, and you can output any one of them. Example 1 and 2.  Any set of size less than or equal to 2 is good by definition. Example 3 onwards.  For each pair of elements in the set, you can see that their sum doesn't exist in the set.    Fetching successful submissions Program should read from  standard input  and write to  standard output .  After you submit a solution you can see your results by clicking on the  [My Submissions]  tab on the problem page.
